(English: SIC is closer to you.") | replaced names = | web= [http://www.sic.pt/ sic.pt/] | terr serv 1=Analogue | terr chan 1=Channel 3 (Until 2012) | terr serv 2=[[Digital Terrestrial Television in Portugal|Digital]] | terr chan 2=Channel 3 (Channel 13 in Azores and Maderia | sat serv 1 = [[ZON MultimÃ©dia|ZON TV]] | sat chan 1 = Channel 3 | sat serv 2 = [[Meo (Portugal)|meo satÃ©lite]] | sat chan 2 = Channel 3 | cable serv 1 = [[ZON MultimÃ©dia|ZON TV]] | cable chan 1 = Channel 3 | cable serv 2 = [[CabovisÃ£o]] | cable chan 2 = Channel 3 | adsl serv 1 = [[Meo (Portugal)|meo]] | adsl chan 1 = Channel 3 | adsl serv 2 = [[Optimus Clix|Optimus Clix TV]] | adsl chan 2 = Channel 3| | adsl serv 3 = [[Vodafone Portugal|Vodafone Casa TV]] | adsl chan 3 = Channel 3| dummy parameter=| |}} '''SIC - Sociedade Independente de ComunicaÃ§Ã£o''' ("Independent Communication Company") is a [[Portugal|Portuguese]] [[television]] network and [[mass media|media]] company, which runs several television channels. Their flagship channel is the eponymous SIC, the third terrestrial [[television]] station in Portugal, launched on October 6, 1992. SIC is owned by [[Impresa]], a Portuguese media conglomerate. The station's [[acronym]] is often a source of amusement by [[English language|English]] speaking celebrities interviewed by SIC. [[Danny DeVito]] once jokingly stated that he liked the acronym because he was "in the same line of work"{{Fact|date=January 2008}} Other channels operated by SIC carried on [[Satellite television|satellite]] and [[Cable television|cable TV]] in Portugal are: *[[SIC NotÃ­cias]], [[news channel]]; *[[SIC Radical]], general entertainment channel targeting a younger audience; *[[SIC Mulher]], general entertainment channel targeting a female audience; *[[SIC K]], general entertainment channel targeting kids; *[[SIC Internacional]], an international channel which broadcasts in [[Europe]], [[Africa]], [[South America]], [[North America]], and [[Australia]]. ==History== [[Image:LogoSICold.png|thumb|200px|left|The first logotype of SIC, used until 1997.]] SIC was the first private television channel to operate in [[Portugal]]. In its first years of existence, SIC was owned by a consortium led by [[Francisco Pinto BalsemÃ£o]], and backed by [[Impresa|Controljornal]] (now ''Impresa Jornais'', a holding that contains Impresa's newspapers and magazines), [[Impala Editores]], [[Banco PortuguÃªs de Investimento|BPI]] and [[Rede Globo]]. SIC was also the first TV channel to acquire huge audiences in just a few years of existence. The most watched programmes in Portugal belong to SIC, which reflect the creativity and sense of innovation of the channel. SIC became widely known in Europe not only for achieving high viewing figures just three years after launching, but for also being the subject of an [[Arte]] documentary, "Cette TÃ©lÃ©vision est la VÃ´tre" (directed by [[Mariana Otero]]). Nowadays, SIC has a programming largely based on talk shows, Brazilian soap operas produced by [[Rede Globo|Globo]], Portuguese soaps, game shows and sketch shows. Like the other major broadcaster, [[TelevisÃ£o Independente|TVI]], SIC airs international TV series such as ''[[Criminal Minds]]'', the various ''[[CSI (franchise)|CSI]]'' series and ''[[Entourage (TV series)|Entourage]]'' always after 1 a.m. SIC also relies largely on Globo productions, due to an exclusivity contract which obligates SIC to broadcast every soap opera produced. In-house productions include occasional reality shows and comedy sketch shows, which include ''Malucos do Riso'', a long-running series with focus on dramatized jokes and ''[[Gato Fedorento]]''. ==Programs== ===Regular=== {| class="wikitable" |- ! !
